column5: I spent April 13-28th in Cayo Coco Cuba this year fly fishing and relaxing , had some good days with Cudas and bonefish , saw sharks , rays,  big sea turtles weather was great. Heres a couple pics from the trip , i didnt get many cause i broke my Camera at the pool bar trying to be funny oops
Looks like a great trip, awesome pics  DIY or did you use a guide at all?
I was there at the same time,awesome weather!!
We mainly went on our own , we did hire a guide on the boat 2 out of the 14 days but its mostly on our own
Cool deal nice place to go I have heard.   Art
Awesome, was wondering how your trip went.
Well done! I was in Cuba at Christmas and caught a bunch of fish but only 2 worth mentioning...
awwwsome looking bonefish!!!.....congrads!!!

Nice silver colored fish!  Re pic 2----you're supposed to disguise background not foreground. pic 3--I think I recognize the background!  I avoid the swim-up pool bars. Nobody ever seems to leave to take a leak!!
Awesome looking bonefish man !!!! They are silver rockets !!!!! Great scenery as well !!! What is the first fish ?? Is that a puffer ?? Cool lookin
its a box fish! similar to a puffer but it can't ''puff''. it has a hard body.
I like the bonefish pics and that puffer is quite big too. Glad you had fun
Very cool!

Sight fishing for Bonefish has to be one of the best experiences ever. Did it several times in south Florida. Just be careful not to step on a Ray. Can be the last thing you ever do. Need to learn to walk and kick, walk and kick. I suggest a guide until you can safely do it alone. Just ask the Crocodile guys widow from Australia.

very nice , interesting that you could find these places on your own, i would think you need local assistance Caya Coco is a separate island north Cuba , am i correct .....    what resort did you stay at ?  bonefish and permit .... on my bucket list ...

If you bring a few cheapo spools of line and some cheap reels to give away you can get local assistance real quick down there.   I  caught a few small tarpon and lots of cuda near the bridge to pilar beach
Oh wow - what's that second pic. I was debating between Cayo Coco and Varadero ... If i had seen this post earlier, I know where I would have gone. Next time. Thx for sharing.
Cool trip man.  That would be a great way to enjoy a southern vacation.!
Its by far my favourite fishing that i've come across so far, i love the sight fishing on a flat
Cool
